abstract.p: Advice on dividing bearded iris and ordering autumn crocus (S)

block.p: Bearded iris should be divided every four years after flowering; this can be done through early August. Cut out and discard any sections damaged by rot or iris borer. Dip healthy three- to four-inch pieces of rhizome in a mild bleach solution or dust with fungicide and replant so that the top of the rhizome is just covered with soil.

It is not too late to order Autumn crocus (Colchicum) for fall bloom: Colchicum speciosum Album, a large weather-resistant white, and C. Waterlily, with double pinkish lilac flowers that do right by their name, are two to try.

Autumn crocus also refers to the true crocuses that bloom then, including Saffron crocus (Crocus sativus). They require full sun and are generally more persnickety about being well drained than Colchicum.
